abstract: French consumer spending on manufactured goods fell more than expected in August.
snippet: French consumer spending on manufactured goods fell more than expected in August.
lead_paragraph: French consumer spending on manufactured goods fell more than expected in August. Household spending on such goods, which accounts for about 15 percent of the economy, fell 0.3 percent from July, when it had risen 0.4 percent, Insee, the national statistics office, said. Spending declined 0.1 percent from a year earlier, the first year-on-year drop since September 1997. “Spending has been flat over the past six months,” said Maryse Pogodzinski, an economist at JPMorgan Chase in Paris. “Shoppers have been hit in the face by huge price increases in food and energy, and now the job market is deteriorating.”

headline.main: France: Consumers Cut Spending on Goods
headline.print_headline: FRANCE: CONSUMERS CUT SPENDING ON GOODS
